channel.title: Help with Client!
channel.description:
Alright, So here's the problem. I gave my friend the client, which I can access 100% fine on all IP's I've tried... But he can't. It either loads and says Error connecting to the server, or it doesn't even open at all. I have indeed portforwarded the Server and such.
If it helps: Client & Source: Hybrid PvP 2 or 3, I forgot. JDK Version: 21
Help please.

item.title: Help with Client!
item.dc:creator: @ModChris ModChris
item.description:
@ModChris wrote:

I just thought about this. There is a line of coding that makes it search for their java and run it on that. Would that work?

EDIT: Just tried the JDK thing. There is now option in any of the run files. They appropriate one for him has this code:

@echo off
title Client
cd ./Class/
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32
pause

EDIT EDIT: When trying to run his Client, it says:

The system cannot find the path specified.
Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Gui
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: Gui
at java.net…
at java…
at…
at…
at…
at…
Could not find the main class: Gui Program will exit.
Press any key to continue.

I didn’t write it all down, it’s way too much.

EDIT EDIT EDIT: He’s on Windows Vista. None of the Run Options work for him.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with Client!
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

ModChris:

But wouldn’t that require me individually making a client for every player that joins?

Think I’m reading this right: You don’t have to continue to make continues client for all the members that join the server, just leave the JDK at one thing and if the member doesn’t know how to change it then that member can post on the forums or do it themselves, takes two seconds.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with Client!
item.dc:creator: @ModChris ModChris
item.description:
@ModChris wrote:

But wouldn’t that require me individually making a client for every player that joins?

item.description:
@drew56133 wrote:

Tell him to update his java jdk to 21 or change the jdk version to his.

Read full topic
